metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5332 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The extract_group_icon_cursor_resource in wrestool/extract.c in icoutils before 0.31.1 can access unallocated memory, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (process crash) and execute arbitrary code via a crafted executable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5332` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icoutils - 0.31.0-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE is for "all of 1aa9f28f7bcbdfff6a84a15ac8d9a87559b1596a and also the index correction in 1a108713ac26215c7568353f6e02e727e6d4b24a."

criterions.comment: icoutils package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.31.0-3ubuntu0.1').
